skill.name: delphi
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "use delphi", "ask delphi", or wants multiple parallel oracle investigations of the same question to discover divergent insights. Delphi launches multiple oracle agents simultaneously with identical prompts, allowing them to independently explore and potentially discover different paths, clues, and solutions. Results are saved to .oracle/[topic]/ and synthesized into a final document.

security_audit.summary: The delphi skill is a documentation-only skill containing instructions for using parallel oracle agents. It contains no executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond creating directories, and no environment variable access. The skill provides safe operational procedures for launching multiple AI agents with identical prompts.

content.value_statement: Complex problems need multiple perspectives. Delphi coordinates parallel AI agents to explore the same question independently, revealing divergent insights you might miss with a single investigation.
actual_capabilities: Creates structured investigation reports in .oracle directories
Synthesizes divergent findings into comprehensive analysis
Exports complete reasoning chains from each oracle
Identifies convergent and divergent findings across investigations
limitations: Requires manual coordination of parallel Task calls
Synthesis quality depends on individual oracle thoroughness
No automatic retry mechanism for failed oracle agents

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use delphi to investigate whether our e-commerce platform should migrate from monolith to microservices. Consider performance, scalability, team structure, and migration complexity.

prompt_templates.title: Bug Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use delphi to investigate why our payment processing randomly fails for 0.1% of transactions. Check logs, recent changes, dependencies, and infrastructure.

prompt_templates.title: Research Synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use delphi to research the current state of WebAssembly for server-side applications. Include performance benchmarks, adoption trends, and production use cases.

prompt_templates.title: Root Cause Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use delphi to investigate the root cause of last week's database performance degradation. Analyze query patterns, configuration changes, and infrastructure metrics.

output_examples.input: Use delphi to investigate why our API response times increased by 300%
output: Oracle 1 discovered a missing database index on the user_activity table
Oracle 2 found a recent code change that added N+1 queries
Oracle 3 identified increased traffic from a new mobile app feature
Synthesis: Combined findings revealed the index issue was exposed by the traffic spike

best_practices: Provide clear success criteria in your oracle prompts
Create descriptive topic names for the .oracle directory
Let oracles explore independently without predetermined paths
anti_patterns: Don't assign different focus areas to each oracle
Avoid launching too many oracles that become hard to synthesize
Don't skip the synthesis step - individual reports aren't the final answer

faq.question: How many oracles should I use?
faq.answer: 3-5 oracles work best. More than 5 creates synthesis challenges without proportional benefit.

faq.question: Can oracles communicate with each other?
faq.answer: No, oracles work independently. This ensures divergent exploration without groupthink.

faq.question: What if an oracle fails or times out?
faq.answer: Check the .oracle directory for partial results. Consider relaunching failed oracles with adjusted prompts.

faq.question: How long does a Delphi consultation take?
faq.answer: Each oracle runs 5-15 minutes. Total time depends on complexity and oracle count.

faq.question: Can I use different models for different oracles?
faq.answer: Yes, but identical models ensure consistent capability across investigations.

faq.question: What makes a good oracle prompt?
faq.answer: Include the core question, relevant context, success criteria, and export instructions.
